template.p: Plan and launch your sport event using Project, CRM, Events, and Website.

li.p: Set up a project in the Project app to assign and track tasks such as venue booking, course setup, and sponsor contact.
Add your event details in the Events app, including dates, locations, ticket types, and capacity.
Record and manage sponsor details in CRM and add them on the Event when it's confirmed
In CRM, create a new opportunity for each sponsor or partner. Record all discussions, meeting notes, and agreed conditions.
Once terms are approved, send the sponsorship contract via the Sign app for a quick, legally binding e-signature.
In the Events app, open your event and use the Sponsor Smart Button to add the confirmed sponsor. Upload their logo and details.
Use the Website app to promote sponsors with their logos, descriptions, and (if relevant) booth details so attendees know where to find them.
Assign booths or areas for sponsors. For example, Sports sponsors your trail race. They have a booth at the finish line where they sell running equipment and promote their latest trail gear.
Publish the event on your Website with an attractive description, photos or videos from previous editions, practical info such as schedules and accessibility, and registration forms.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

ul.li: Add specific questions to the registration form in the Events app, such as emergency contact details or T-shirt size, so you collect all necessary information from participants during the registration process.
Use the Barcode app to scan tickets and give participants their race bibs or event packs easily.
Create pricelists to offer specific prices tailored to different groups, such as partners, athletes with a license, or staff members.

template.p: Streamline purchasing for sport event supplies using the Purchase app.

li.p: Create a purchase order in Purchase when you need ravitaillement supplies, race bibs, signage, timing systems, volunteer uniforms, or safety equipment.
Select the right vendor by comparing prices, delivery times, and supplier reliability to ensure quality and timely delivery.
Send a Request for Quotation (RFQ) to suppliers directly from Odoo or confirm the order when you've made your choice.
Track the order in Purchase to monitor expected delivery dates.
Receive the goods using the Receipt smart button and validate them to update your records.

template.p: Keep sports gear and event materials organized with the Inventory app.

li.p: Open the Inventory app and find the product or equipment to manage (e.g., finish line arch, water station tables, first aid kits).
Categorize products into groups like Apparel, First Aid, Technical Equipment, and Merchandise.

Organize and Monitor stock by locations: Create clear storage locations in Odoo such as Merch & Apparel, Ravito, and Equipment. This helps you and your team find materials quickly when setting up for the event.
Use Smart Buttons to view stock moves and track the history of each item.
Set Reordering Rules by defining minimum and maximum stock levels. Example: Keep at least 200 gels in stock, and replenish up to 500 when you drop below the threshold.
Automate reordering so when stock falls below the minimum, Odoo generates a purchase order automatically.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

ul.li: Add vendor lead times on each product to plan ahead. For example, if importing race medals takes 10 days, set that lead time so you order in time.

Export your inventory list from Odoo to a spreadsheet and create a column for ‚ÄúQuantity Required‚Äù for a specific event. Event managers can fill in this column so the Inventory Manager can compare it with ‚ÄúQuantity on Hand‚Äù and instantly know what needs to be reordered.

template.h3: Keep Your Community Engaged with Your Website
template.p: Promote new events and connect with your community using the Website app.

li.p: Create engaging announcements and highlight reels to promote upcoming events.
Add contact forms for participants to send questions, feedback, or requests.

Showcase your value proposition and current sponsors with logos, testimonials, and success stories. Include a sponsor interest form that, when submitted, automatically creates an opportunity in the CRM. This allows your team to track sponsor activity, follow up effectively, and work toward converting them into long-term partners.

template.p: Assign and communicate staff roles via the Planning app.

ol.li: Define your event hours (e.g., 7am‚Äì8pm, race day and setup days)
Create roles like ‚ÄúSecurity,‚Äù ‚ÄúMedical Staff,‚Äù ‚ÄúRegistration Desk,‚Äù or ‚ÄúCourse Marshal,‚Äù and assign them to each team member‚Äôs record, on Employee app
Use the auto-plan feature to assign staff based on their availability and expertise.
Each staff member can view their schedule via their portal or receive it by email
Need to make last-minute changes? Drag-and-drop scheduling updates keep everyone informed instantly.

template.p: Manage event finances with the Invoicing and Expenses apps.

li.p: Log expenses like staff accommodation the day before the event, catering, or travel.
Categorize expenses (Logistics, Accommodation, Meals, Travel) for clear reporting.
Generate invoices for sponsors, partners, or booth rentals.
Track payments and send reminders for overdue invoices.

template.p: Collect feedback using the Survey app.

li.p: Create surveys on event organization, facilities, or satisfaction.
Send them to participants, staff, and sponsors after the event.
Analyze responses to improve future events (e.g., add more ravitaillement points) or to use them to demonstrate the event's impact on local tourism when negotiating new editions or funding.

template.h3: Example Workflow for a Sport Event

li.p: Use the Project app to organize the event by creating tasks, assigning assignees, setting deadlines, and tracking progress.

Create the event in the Events app with all details (dates, locations, ticket types, and capacity) and, after negotiating sponsorship deals in CRM and finalizing contracts in Sign, add confirmed sponsors with their booth locations.
Promote the event on the Website with sponsor logos, descriptions, media from previous editions, practical info, and ticket registration.
Check your entire inventory, update the spreadsheet with the quantities required for the event, and identify any shortages.
Based on that list, the logistic manager can reorder missing items by creating purchase orders in Purchase for essentials like hydration points, signage, and timing equipment.
Assign staff shifts in Planning for setup, race marshaling, registration, and cleanup.

Run the event: thanks to the inventory list, the logistics manager knows exactly what to bring; use the Barcode app to scan participant tickets and assign bib numbers; check your staff planning and enjoy the event.
Send a post-event survey via Survey to participants and partners, then review income and expenses in Invoicing and Expenses before closing the project.
